titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. David Shroeder and John Shroeder, Indictment
CWG0892

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1863-1867

body.p:
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
AGAINST
David Shroeder and John Shroeder
Jefferson Circuit Court,
October Term, A. D. 1863.

The Grand Jurors of the County of Jefferson in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse David Shroeder and John Shroeder of the crime of malicious stabbing with the intent to kill committed in the manner and form as follows, to=wit: The said David Shroeder and John Shroeder in the said County of Jefferson on the 7th day of September A. D. 1863 did wilfully, wickedly, feloniously and of their malice aforethought cut and stab Andrew Dora with a Knife, and other sharp instrument and weapon in and upon the body of the said Dora wounding & not killing the said Dora but with the intent to kill him contrary to the form of the statute in such cases, made and provided against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

Witnesses
A Copy
att Jas P Chambers C. J. C. C.

We of the Jury find the accused David Shrader and John Shrader guilty as charged in the within indictment and say that David Shroeder shall be confined in the Jail and Penitentiary house of this Commonwealth for the term of two years -- and further say that John Shrader shall be confined in the Jail and Penitentiary of this Commonwealth for the term of one year and we reccommend John Shrader especially to the clemency of his Honor the Govenor.
A Copy att Jas P Chambers C. J C. C

The Commonwealth of Kentucky.
Indictment.
Malicious Stabbing
David Shroeder & John Shroeder
A True Bill.
Jos T Tompkins
Foreman.
1863 Octo 20th Recd from Grand Jury & filed
A Copy att J P Chambers
